section.p: The story concerns a hairy old bogle who used to eat anyone who strolled too close to his lair. One day he caught a young maid who begged to be given a day to set her affairs in order. This tickled the bogle’s humour so much that he said he’d spare her life if she could tell him what his name was.
The maid pretended to go back home to see to her affairs, but in fact she hid near the bogle’s lair, and so she overheard him singing to himself:
‘I’ll be making a meal of a plump milkmaid
Who doesn’t know my name is Friddle McCade!’
But, of course, when she came back the next day she was able to name the bogle, and so she lived happily ever after.

That seems to be the end of the story.
